intro: Cynanchum boveanum, commonly known as the Bovean milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with slender stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and are pollinated by insects. Cynanchum boveanum is adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that help it survive in drought conditions.
